title: Bug 21706 - BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
description: The BidiUtil class in the win32 version has a usage of Class.forName() which causes a NoClassDefFoundError in the CLDC version of SWT. The compiler does not throw a compilation error but assumes that NoClassDefFoundError is available. To resolve this issue, a private constructor should be added to the BidiUtil class.
OB: The BidiUtil class in the win32 version uses Class.forName() which throws a NoClassDefFoundError in the CLDC version of SWT.
EB: To resolve this issue, add a private constructor to the BidiUtil class. Since there are no nonstatic methods in this class, preventing instantiation by making the constructor private would be a good practice.
